Collection¶

collection.group_by(collection, get_property)[source]¶

For a list of items, group them by some property and return tuples of that property and all items that have it.

Similar to itertools.groupby(), but that requires the items to be ordered by that property; more efficient but annoying to use.

>>> for unique_prop, items in group_by(items, lambda item: item.name).items():
        print '%s: %d' % (unique_prop, len(items))
